forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Mamdani consolidates the anti-Cuomo vote, benefits from second-choice transfers from other progressive candidates in RCV, and overtakes Cuomo in later rounds, or a late-breaking event (endorsement wave/negative story/turnout differential) shifts first-choice shares away from Cuomo.

forecast.rationale:
Time horizon is short and the main signal we have is a poll showing Cuomo still leading while Mamdani gains. With New York City’s Democratic primary using ranked-choice voting, a polarizing frontrunner can be vulnerable if most other voters list someone else and transfers coalesce against him. However, status quo dynamics—name recognition, a likely fragmented field, and the tendency for late-deciding, lower-information voters to break toward the best-known candidate—slightly favor Cuomo. If Eric Adams is not in the race, much of the moderate/outer-borough coalition that won in 2021 is up for grabs; Cuomo is a plausible inheritor of a chunk of that vote, even with high negatives. Conversely, Mamdani’s progressive base is intense but may have a ceiling citywide unless he captures broad second-choice support beyond the left. 

Reasons my forecast isn’t higher: Cuomo’s liabilities (scandals, high unfavorables) make him unusually exposed in RCV; a close race in late polling suggests real risk that transfers break against him. Reasons it isn’t lower: he remains the leader in available polling, retains superior name recognition, and benefits from any fragmentation among non-left candidates. 

What would move me up: fresh high-quality polls showing Cuomo expanding his lead (especially on head-to-head RCV simulations), major union/borough-machine endorsements breaking decisively for him, and early vote data suggesting strong moderate, outer-borough turnout. What would move me down: credible polling with Mamdani ahead or showing Cuomo’s negatives climbing, a consolidated progressive/left endorsement slate clearly steering transfers to Mamdani, or reporting that other non-left candidates are fading and their voters intend to rank Mamdani above Cuomo.
